lines.text: You don't drink on duty?
Only scotch!
[breaking into a suspect's house and rousing him from his bed]
Get your trousers on - you're nicked!
Will I see you tonight?
No.
Tomorrow night?
Definitely.
Oooh. One night in nine. Not bad. Who gets you the other eight?
I'm sorry, Annie. I've got a big job on.
Is that right? Tell me, Jack, when do you ever have a *small* job on?
Tomorrow night, I promise.
Knockout. I'll run home now, get into my negligee and wait by the window.
You heard the latest brainwave?
No.

Flying Squad, Robbery Squad, Regional Crime Squad - all amalgamated into one sprawling mess. There'll be hundreds of little grey men, all working on top of each other, pots of tea and committees. I'm one of the best DIs in the Squad, d'you know that? They don't listen to me - they listen to committee men now.
Cowley's dead. The doctors say they can't make a case about which injuries killed him - the beating or the car. Yeah, it means we can't even do the bastards for murder.
[Cowley lived with his grandmother. Regan has just been to break the news to her that he is dead]
How did she take it?
D'you know something? That old lady's got no reason to go on living now. Whoever killed Cowley killed *two* people.
[Regan and Carter go to interview Morton at the ice rink]
It's a bit cold in here.

[sarcastically]
That's cos of the ice.
Thanks. How many O levels have you got?
[Regan and Carter are interviewing Morton]
this is a colleague of mine. He hits people. Isn't that right, colleague?
[Carter tries to look frightening]
He's got a miracle technique. D'you wanna see it?
What d'you wanna know?
Mallory's got a house in the country, hasn't he?
No.

[to Carter]
Hit 'im!
[Carter pushes Morton against the wall. Morton reluctantly gives the information that Regan wants]
I'd like you to answer a few questions.
As a general rule I don't do that kind of thing.
You say you get six months off for good behaviour. I'm saying "what good behaviour?". You just hit me. That means the full eighteen months plus an additional sentence for assaulting a police officer.
I haven't hit you.
No, no. My sergeant's gonna hit me, but I'm gonna say you hit me.
You'd pull that one, eh?

You know I would. Now you're going to give me information. I'm going to go away and check it. And if it's wrong I'm going to come back and you're going to hit me again. And you're going to get another three years.
You bastard.
[Regan grins]
[Regan has just arrested Dale for murdering Mallory and Cowley. He looks at the tax disc on Dale's car]
This stinking heap is licensed till March. It's April the twentieth. I'll have you for that, an' all!
This afternoon I ordered you to be suspended, pending disciplinary charges.

[drily]
So I hear.

You'd done a fairish job. Serious Crime Squad had twenty men on it and they'd no idea he was dead. And you got Dale for that and for killing Cowley. Poor Cowley. He was roaming around out there, not writing reports, not communicating with anybody - *your* responsibility. But just like you roam around out there.
[Regan looks uncomfortable]

Jack, the days of one-man bands are over now we're in an orchestra. Every move you made could have been made with the necessary authority, tact and diplomacy. As it is, you've made SCS look like fools and Laker your sworn enemy. And, what's most important, you could have ended up dead like Cowley.

[defiantly]
Did I get the result?

You're a gambler, Jack. You played a long shot and it came up. That's why we're ringing the changes. No more lone rangers. From now on you'll be one two-hundredth part of any successful case - not the hero of the hour. I have a feeling you're not going to buy this. But think about it. And I'll think about you. Somehow we've got to find a way of making you work as part of a team. Or go away - get right out of it.
[Dale's henchmen are waiting for him to give the order to shoot Regan. Regan tells Dale that Carter would kill him in that case, but Dale calls his bluff]

[to Dale's henchmen]
We're the Sweeney! We kill him - nothing! You kill us - thirty years!
